finalproject

Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalproject.Store

  • public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
    The central hub for everything in this package. Whenever a user wants to make a change, they usually have to go through Store to accomplish it. Store ensures that only users with correct permissions are able to carry out tasks. Store also ensures synchronization between the data held in memory and the data stored in the CSV files.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Store

        public Store(java.lang.String csvPath)
      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
             java.io.IOException
        Constructor that takes a .csv file pathname. Information such as products and users stored in the csv file is loaded into the class as different data structures.
        Parameters:
        csvPath - The .csv file that the constructor loads from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static User login(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a username if a successful login is performed by a user. A successful log-in by a user will also generate a unique sessionID as an authentication token.

        A log-in is successful if the username the user provides is in the csv file the Store reads from, and the password provided is correct.

        Parameters:
        username - The username to login to the Store
        password - The password to go with the username provided
        Returns:
        The user who logged in. null if login unsuccessful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • logout

        public void logout(int sessionID)
        Logs out user, removes sessionID from list of active session. If the user was a shopper, releases all reserved quantities to other potential shoppers.
        Parameters:
        sessionID -

      • createShopper

        public boolean createShopper(java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String password)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Creates and adds a new Shopper into the Store. The new shopper is put into the list of Users, and then written to the CSV file the Store reads from.
        Parameters:
        username - The username to login to the Store
        password - The password to go with the username provided
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                         City city,

                  throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:

        city - City object representing the city the Shopper lives in
        address - Street address of the Shopper
        sessionID - A valid sessionID of a logged in Customer

      • createAdmin

        public boolean createAdmin(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Creates and adds a new Administrator into the Store. The new Administrator is put into the list of users, and then written to the CSV file the Store reads from.
        Parameters:
        username - The username to login to the Store
        password - The password to go with the username provided
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addProduct

        public static int addProduct(Category category,
                             java.lang.String image,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String description,
                             double price,
                             int sessionID)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a new Product into the store. The new Product is then put into the list of products, and then written to the CSV file the Store reads from. The new Product will have an initial quantity of zero.

        A Product can only be added if the Store determines that an Administrator is accessing this method. A sessionID that belongs to an Administrator must be provided.

        Parameters:
        category - Category type of the Product, for example a T-shirt
        image - An Image of the Product.
        name - The name of the Product.
        description - The description of the Product.
        price - The price of the Product.
        sessionID - The sessionID of the user who is attempting to use this method.
        Returns:
        -> The productID. -1 if unsuccessful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • addProduct

        public static int addProduct(Product product,
                             int sessionID)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Add a new product to the store.
        Parameters:
        product -
        sessionID -
        Returns:
        -> ProductID if successful. -1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • modifyProduct

        public static void modifyProduct(Product product,
                                 Category category,
                                 java.lang.String image,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String description,
                                 double price,
                                 int sessionID)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Modifies a Product that currently exists in the Store. The updated Product is written back into the CSV file the Store reads from.

        A Product can only be modified if the Store determines that an Administrator is accessing this method. A sessionID that belongs to an Administrator must be provided.

        Parameters:
        product - The Product that is being modified.
        category -
        image - An Image of the Product.
        name - The name of the Product.
        description - The description of the Product.
        price - The price of the Product
        sessionID - The sessionID of the user who is attempting to use this method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • modifyQuantity

        public static boolean modifyQuantity(Product product,
                                     City city,
                                     int newStock,
                                     int sessionID)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Modifies the quantity in a particular warehouse for a particular product.
        Parameters:
        product - -> The product that is being modified.
        city - -> The city in which the distribution center stock is changing.
        newStock - -> The quantity value to change to
        sessionID - -> a sessionID to check if a logged in admin is attempting the change.
        Returns:
        -> true is successful, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Parameters:
        sessionID - The sessionID of the user who is attempting to use this method.
        Returns:

        Returns a boolean value to check if an authenticated user is an Administrator by checking the user's sessionID.
        Parameters:
        sessionID - The sessionID of the user who is attempting to use this method.
        Returns:
        True is sessionID belongs to a logged in shopper, false otherwise.

      • addCategory

        public static int addCategory(java.lang.String category,
                              int sessionID)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a category of products to the ArrayList of categories in the Store.

        A category can only be added if the Store determines that an Administrator is accessing this method. A sessionID that belongs to an Administrator must be provided.

        Parameters:
        category - Category of Product to be added.
        sessionID - The sessionID of the user attempting to use this method.
        Returns:
        CategoryID if successful, -1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        A string of all sales in the store to date.

                       throws java.io.IOException
        Modifies a city to either become a warehouse or cease to be a warehouse.
        Parameters:
        city -
        distribution - -> true if changing to warehouse, false if changing from warehouse to regular city.

        Throws:
